title: Can someone give me some like, deep analysis as to why Sona is apparently overpowered?
body:
I don't really see Sona being overpowered, but even else seems to, and I'm really interested into hearing why.

EDIT : I'm asking a legit question, I don't see reason for downvotes.

replies.body:
Sona is the definition of glass cannon.
She doesn't have an escape after engaging other than her R -> E -> run combo.
She cannot turn untargetable/invisible like some champs. She will always be there for your to farm.

Because people love to keep pushing against poke champs down in bot lane, Sona gets to poke you down to hell.
Playing passively (I mean lasthitting but not pushing) and thus NOT letting her poke you down will cause their lane to push.
Ask for a gank and viola!
Sona is too squishy; she has to back off using Flash against a good gank because in bot lane against a Sona, you don't focus the enemy ADC but on Sona because it is much much easier.
She will die before her ADC can deal a decent damage to anyone.
Farm her for some free gold and take advantage of the difference in numbers to push minions into tower.

Many people think Sona is too dangerous to engage on but it is the opposite; Sona cannot escape from a good engage.
You could even engage with a squishy support to end up by killing her, but not dying as well.
Veigar

She's not OP, this is just the propaganda that Riot and specific individuals who don't play Sona want you to believe.  Just look at the numbers and 21 nerfs yourself and anyone with basic understanding of this game will be disgusted at how trashy and under-tuned her entire kit has become.

* Reduced base HP(5th lowest in the game at both levels 1 AND 18).
* Staccato has been blatantly nerfed by 60%, no compensations made.
* Longer cooldowns across all of her spells.
* Auras removed and replaced with 65% shorter 1-off effects.
* Weaker bolt damage(tied for lowest base damage in the support class).
* Weak on-hit, doesn't apply to spells, doesn't affect structures.
* Higher mana costs(most expensive heal and shield in the game).
* Weakest heal in the game(at max tied with 2nd weakest heal), reduced scaling.
* Weak shield, duration cut in half.
* No compensation made for removing Celerity's aura, which additionally benefited minions.
* Ult increases in cost per-rank.

She has the shortest spell range amongst the mage-support class at 350 units, 2nd lowest being 500 units, 43% longer and most spells sitting around ~850 range, give or take.  Being tied with Taric's 2 damage spells and Leona's Q for lowest base damage at 40, Sona has the 2nd lowest max potential trading damage amongst the support class, 2nd only to Braum.  The heal and shield are the weakest, most expensive and lowest duration in the game.  She lacks a dash and is tied for the weakest MS boos and has the lowest base MS in the game at 325.  She has the least pre-6 CC of the support class and is only 1 of 2 lacking hard pre-6 CC.  All whilst being amongst the top 10 squishiest champions in the game and being forced to rely on average attack-range at only 550.

The fact that Crescendo isn't 100 base mana at all ranks, whence every other support was generalized to this well over a year ago is inherent proof Riot biasedly hates Sona and intentionally wishes for her failure.  They purposefully created a bad rework and are following it up with repeated nerfs since her pick-rate hasn't dropped to 0% yet.  In total, Sona's current number of nerfs since July 30th to date stand at 21 and counting.

Imo she was not very good before the nerfs. Riot just doesn't like early game poke and has been nerfing all of them. I don't really understand why early game poke is op, why there isn't any compensation for the early poke nerfs, why they are giving the reason that the nerfs are for reducing anti-fun and snowball (when all-ins are much more effective than poke for early game snowball), or why they decided to nerf sona even more. I'm honestly not sure what riot has been thinking these few couple of patches. Sona, mana regen, not touching assassins, indirectly buffing resourceless, making jungle an inconsequential role, etc.
I'm not a sona player myself as I think she sucks. There's only so much utility you can bring as a support when your only hard cc is your ultimate (kat ulti is not on cooldown but mine is, 30 seconds later... pentakill!) and you have no hard melee peel (besides a little extra movespeed for your adc). If shields or heals or slows or move speed is needed, there are item actives for that, but no item active gives hard cc.

She isn't overpowered.

I like saving the term overpowered for champions that are actually warping the game in a negative way.

Sona is just overtuned (lol music pun).

Check how much damage her Q OnHit deals when you take into account the fact that her whole team gets it.

While @LastNameIceCream's analysis is quite - for lack of a better word - simple, it I think pretty much describes the essence of it.  She has decently high lane poke on top of a short cool down heal/shield.  Yes she can be countered, yes she has weaknesses, but overall her play style is high rewards for high safety.  

Usually the counterpoint here is that "well if you jump on her..." and when should that be done, because unless you engage and beat her at level 1, she is now in control of her lane at level 2.  There are a good many things that can be done to reduce her effectiveness in lane, but the matter of fact is it shouldn't be a "find a way to counter her or die trying" situation.  Every other aggro support the solution is just to position well and poke down upon failed aggro, but with Sona doing that means you've now lost up to 25% of your life.

One of the strongest.  But past that she is nothing.  I believe Riot wants to tweak her laning, which is what I'm assuming a small decrease in her MS does since, let's face it, late game that 5 MS means nothing between her upgraded boots and activated speed boost.  Does she need tweaking?  I think the answer is ultimately yes. Should she be a top priority or one at all?  Probably not.  But I'm not trying to prove that she is broken, because she isn't, but it is a harder time than it is against most supports in soloQ because she doesn't require as much adc interaction to get her job done, compared to say Leona or Thresh.  Personally I think they need to siphon power off of her Q and give her more utility shifted towards mid to late game presence.

I'm not super sold that Sona is OP.  

Sona is strong because she has really impressive trading power in lane and an awesome ultimate for teamfights.  In particular, if you get good at using Sona's AA reset on power chord, you can absolutely chunk people.  Sona's new W is quite powerful in scramble situations where everyone in the lane is low.  She can sustain up from 20% to 60% quite quickly.  Combine these two effects and you have a champion that can reasonably expect to win almost every lane.  

In teamfights, Sona is still mostly a walking ult, but her new E does enable easier catches.
the smartest thing you can do most of the time in the game is to sit back, play safe, and subtly help your team as much as possible.  sona is the easiest character who does that the most effectively.

Individually for her abilities:
Her [Q] is undodgeable and won't care if you burn flash or dashes trying to not get hit by it.
Her [W] makes it difficult to trade and out-poke her.
Her [E] gives a fair amount of MS and that can be used any number of ways.
Her [R] is almost instant and thus practically undodgeable, capable of stunning a whole team.
Her passive's utility is strong, especially since it will be up so often.
She becomes stronger and stronger as the progresses, so her early phase barely compares to her power in the late game.
Her auras scale with AP and CDR, making them even more effective in team situations, and there is no limit to how many benefit.

Let's move on to her item synergy:
Ardent Censer lets her [W] proc the attack speed for the entire team, on top of the initial heal.
Lich Bane makes her [Q] pack a wallop, and will make building her as an APC hurt.
Aegis of the Legion makes her [W] more efficient.

Due to her playstyle, her only counters are to pick the hard-engage tank supports Thresh, Blitz, Leona, or go with Braum and block all of her damage. Annie can maybe punish her, too, but that's more of a skill-matchup.
Trying to counter her alone doesn't really help since her greatest strength is working with her team, and a smart Sona does not stray from her team for too long, so picking her off is difficult without wasting everything only to have to deal with her carries right afterwards.

When directly comparing her to another support, they likely have to land skillshots or manage a more convoluted method of using an ability. At 100% potential and accuracy, Nami and Karma can and will surpass her, but since you can't land *all* of your skillshots or *always* proc off the secondary effects of your spells *and* make it worthwhile because of the enemy team's reflexes or through your own error, Sona's consistency and simplicity stays superior.

Need it any more in-depth? No, I will not be providing a tl;dr.
